title: Better Nerf Irelia Meme has been transferred to Malzahar
body:
Riot claims to not balance champions based on professional play, yet they continue to do so anyways.

People who claim all of this is justified because Malzahar was just way too oppressive need to get off their high horses just because their main wasn't nerfed because a lot of champions are oppressive and hardly any of them are getting string after string of flat out nerfs without compensation.

What is with their micro focus on making Malzahar unplayable? This is some of the worst balancing decisions ever. So it's ok to have a handful of professionally spammed champions like Lee Sin and Orianna spammed all the time but its a problem when Malzahar sees any competitive play? No one played him before the rework and he was just fine and had a clear cut kit. Now what's the point of playing him with all of his endless pure nerf with zero compensation kit?

Just revert this failed experiment, this is the worst, you shouldn't nerf a champion so its completely unplayable.

"Balancing" a champion by constantly nerfing it so no one plays it means you failed in your kit designs and need to start over, this is not an appropriate way to handle a problem.

replies.body:
I main Ryze, and Malzahar was very oppressive when he was reworked. I was surprised it managed to get out live in the state he was. In fact, Ryze had the lowest win rate vs Malzahar for a while sitting in the 30s%. He was pretty unfun to play against.

Then his passive got nerfed. Okay I thought.
Then his passive got nerfed again heavily. That's a pretty big hit but he's still FotM and dominating.
Then his voidlings got "changed". He's still space aids.
Then his voidlings got straight up nerfed. Okay Riot, maybe that's enough.
Then his voidlings got nerfed again! 

At this point I don't even mind Malzahar. While he was completely destroying me before, I feel that those nerfs were unjustified. Maybe if one or two of them gone through. But seeing a champion get nerfed again and again and again is hard to watch. Even if I hate that champion.

Maybe it's because Ryze is on a similar boat. Good in competitive and bad in solo queue. Just nerf and nerf and nerf and oh well. Welcome to the club buddy. Meanwhile a blind monk ward hops right in front of the balancing team's eyes.

The problem stems from the poorly designed W.

If you don't focus him or his voidlings, they to a ton of damage. If you address them, they do basically nothing. 

Now, while he had the advantage of being over tuned, allowing him to be played in match ups like ryze, and completely dominate. On a basic design level, his W is more powerful in a support position than a primary laning position, because he is more often not priority. 

They keep wanting to nerf him because his support play is too strong, but so long as his kill potential is stuffed into his W, his support play will always be better than any other position (besides jungle maybe), as a result of being able to actually maximize the power of his W. Unlike other lanes which will instantly delete his voidlings (resulting in 0 damage) or have the enemy instantly back off the moment you start your 10 second delayed burst damage.

>Riot claims to not balance champions based on professional play, yet they continue to do so anyways.

No, they admit to doing so. (As they do with other champions) What they admit is that they try to balance for pro AND pub play. Which doesn't work at this point because of what is required to be changed. They also balance around PUB play and that's why you see random things like Volibear nerfs or Cho'gath mini-reworks.
If anything is ever changed about Heimer it's not for pro play, I can guarantee you that, for another example of pub balance.
Well the current batch of Heimer changes is actually based around fixing him so that there's a *chance* he's viable in high elo/pro scene without breaking pubs
waiting on the nasus nerfs next patch >:)

And my main was nerfed for the exact reason. (among others.) {{champion:268}}

But it was promised that Malz would receive help for his midlane when the support nerfs came through?

Instead they are just directly gutting him and leaving him for dead with not the slightest hint of any help for mid :(

Right now it's manageable, his minions are a bit stupid but due to the 2 hit requirment they aren't completely useless.  You can manage in lane by being sneaky. 

But nerfing it down to a single hit? They will just instantly die from any AOE, any waveclear or you know,....sunfire cape. 

They shifted power from his E, Q and R to his passive and W.

Then they nerfed the passive because it was a really god damm awful passive that could never not be OP without being borderline bad. 

Then now they are nerfing his minions because they are too powerful.

But Riot haven't said anything about buffing E-Q-R that got their power cut to enhance the other stuff, thus slowly making him harder and harder to play mid and if the 1 hp minion nerf goes through then it will be hell.

His minions won't provide waveclear, they won't work for teamfights and they won't work against ADC's with Runaan or a tank with sunfire....or you know.

AOE in general.

That's.....kinda admirable  but i can't see it working since E moves you into shooting distance for tanks and ADCs. As a mage you´d get dumpstered, especially now that both tanks and ADC's have been buffed along with mage supports.
I would play him kind of like Rumble, on the tankier side. You'd be a Shurima Shuffle bot after engaging, so it wouldn't be that much of a problem.

That i did not write though? I stated that riot, despite promising not to, are nerfing him to the ground where he´ll become like Azir soon enough. He is not there yet.

Both Azir and Malz are bottom tier at the moment, just that Azir is further down. 


Every single Malzahar main that was active on the forums or Reddit protested the changes to his passive and W stating that they were highly inbalanced and would be hard as hell to balance. But the lead designer choose to ignore them and went ahead with his idea's anyway.

The result? A guy so OP that he could walk up to a Syndra and kill her in a single rotation without losing 50% hp, he could win 1v2 against a early ADC and support, against a jungler and midlaner ( i actually did that so i know) .

And so as we all expected he was consecutively nerfed, because his passive was way too strong, because his W was oppressive as hell to deal with unless you can oneshot him. 


But now after the nerfs? Passive is decent/good, it won't save you if an assassin goes all in but it does prevent sudden chain CC combo´s. 

W is kinda bad but it´s workable.  E-Q are gimmicky but they also work. Ulti needs a ton of AP to do anything but that is fine as well since it's so strong in terms of CC. 

But further nerfing his W? He won´t have any waveclear left since E and Q were nerfed to move power into W ( less damage and higher mana costs), his minions will be even more useless for teamfights and he might as well not have the ability to call them since it won't be used anyway. 


All this despite a lot of promising not to do it. 

I wouldn't be so mad if they just straight up said something like " Alright this wasn't such a great idea so we're dumpstering him until further notice"  but instead they act like it's not an issue and promise to "do a few small tweaks" that "won't affect midlane malz or if they do we´ll buff him to compensate" and instead they just straight up nerf him and leave it at that. 

This is why the malz players are feeling quite discontent :(

Spammable minons....except malz can't afford the mana cost and they can't do anything except push empty lanes.....

So very useful....or not at all actually.
You do realize that the 1-hit part only applies to auto attacks right?

How so? Many spells, even AOE, deal roughly 70-100 damage at lvl 1. 

The bottom line there is more than 20 over the minions health.

Ziggs Q = 75

Ahri Q = 80.

Xerath Q = 80.

Vel koz W = 75.

And those with lower all tend to have roughly 60 or slightly more.  

So just a little AP and a single AOE spell with render malz W, null.

And i didn't count AP, nor did i count the fact that those spells all scale like 20+ damager per rank so that when malz can actual summon 3 of them it's already very easy for the opponent to KO them.

Ok, let's agree to disagree.

I prefer to wait and see how a change turns out instead of complaining about changes on paper, not everybody is like me though.
Alright let's do that.
They are buffing him. Don't comment on what rioters say if you don't read it all.

How are they buffing him? They are changing it from a 2-3 hits bar to a 60 health ( that's 1 hit! ) That scales like +3 per lvl ( still one hit!)

Removing all the movespeed, lowering the duration but indeed a few buffs to damage.

Oh and you can summon up to 3 of them at once, if you use the other spells first. 

Which....is completely irrelevant since they still die of a single hit from anything besides a minion, and they don't have the movepseed to catchup if the opponent is running away anymore, oh joy. 


What good is buffing the minions damage and pushing if they won't survive to use it?  It looks good on paper but a single spell from the opponent and that sweet 3 minion summon you just spent 230-ish mana has gone down the drain. 

So effectively minions in that state are fairly damm useless as long as the opponent has the presence of mind to land a single spell on them when they spawn. Or if they try to walk toward a runaan user....or a sunfire user. 

Yay minions can now push empty lanes faster.....splitpush malz sounds great....

He wasn't too oppressive, he was just good at forcing the lane's tempo. 

There is a tempo arms race going on right now, where higher tempo aggressive champions have a clear advantage over relatively lower tempo aggressive champions. 

Malzahar acted as a kind of limiter on this tempo growth. Not that he was in every game, but without giving every high tempo champion, some method of disrupting his tempo breaking (e.g. fizz ult), then he would become more powerful as he equally successfully brought champion who were designed to be played at a high tempo, down to a lower tempo of play. 

Basically, riot doesn't like champions who are designed to resist their biased design.
